subject: Productivity
title: Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs.

hook.text: Abraham Maslow stacked human needs into a pyramid in 1943. It became the most famous diagram in psychology.

buildup.text: The base: food, shelter, safety. The middle: belonging and esteem. The peak: self-actualization.

discovery.text: Maslow argued you must satisfy lower needs before pursuing higher ones. Hungry people don't seek purpose.

twist.text: Maslow never actually drew a pyramid. And modern research shows people pursue multiple levels simultaneously.

climax.text: The hierarchy is a useful metaphor, not a rigid law. Needs interact rather than stack neatly.

punchline.text: The pyramid is iconic. It's also oversimplified.

quiz.question: What is at the top of Maslow's hierarchy?
